SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.novell.ldapchai.util
Class ConfigObjectRecord

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.util.ConfigObjectRecord

public class ConfigObjectRecord
extends Object

Represents a config object record stored in eDirectory used for holding complex data types. Config object records are comprised of guids and a payload. The payload is typically an XML document but can be any data type representable as a string (and potentially even binary data).

Config object records, or CORs are useful for storing blobs, xml documents, and even access control lists.

CORs should be stored on a multi-valued case-ignore-string attribute. Mutiple CORs can be written to a single attribute value. The ConfigObjectRecord class is capable of distinguishing the appropriate COR based on the supplied guids.

The guid values are used to tie a COR on one entry to a remote entry. For some use cases, it is useful to think of a COR as a sort of advanced DN attribute. It indicates a relationship to another entry, however it is also possible to add aditional information about the remote object reference. This information can be used to describe the conditions of the relationship.

Format

 +------+-------+-------+---------------------------+
 | TYPE | GUID1 | GUID2 | PAYLOAD                   |
 +------+-------+-------+---------------------------+

Example

 0002#{3F2504E0-4F89-11D3-9A0C-0305E82C3301}#.#<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><config">...</config>

TYPEIndicates the TYPE of data resting in the payload. By convention, a four character string integer such as "0001" is used.
GUID1 Optional value for the GUID of a related object
GUID2 Optional value for the GUID of a second related object
PAYLOAD Payload value. Typically in XML format, but any String is permitted.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

createNew

public static ConfigObjectRecord createNew(ChaiEntry entry,
                                           String attr,
                                           String recordType,
                                           String guid1,
                                           String guid2)
Create a new config object record. This will only create a java object representing the config object record. It is up to the caller to call the updatePayload method which will actually commit the record to the directory.

Parameters:
entry - The ChaiEntry object where the config object record will be stored.
attr - The ldap attribute name to use for storage.
recordType - Record type for the record.
guid1 - The first associated guid value
guid2 - The second associated guid value
Returns:
A ConfigObjectRecordInstance

readRecordFromLDAP

public static List<ConfigObjectRecord> readRecordFromLDAP(ChaiEntry ldapEntry,
                                                          String attr,
                                                          String recordType,
                                                          Set guid1,
                                                          Set guid2)
                                                   throws ChaiOperationException,
                                                          ChaiUnavailableException
Retreive matching config object records from the directory.

Parameters:
ldapEntry - The ldapEntry object to examine. Must be a valid entry.
attr - The attribute used to store COR's
recordType - the record recordType to use, can not be null.
guid1 - GUID1 value to match on, may be null if no guid1 match is desired.
guid2 - GUID2 value to match on, may be null if no guid2 match is desired.
Returns:
A List containing matching ConfigObjectRecords
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

parseString

public static ConfigObjectRecord parseString(String input)
Read a string value and convert to a ConfigObjectRecord.

Parameters:
input - a complete config object record string including type, guids and payload.
Returns:
A COR parsed from the inputString

updatePayload

public final void updatePayload(String payload)
                         throws ChaiOperationException,
                                ChaiUnavailableException
Updates the payload both in the directory and in the object instance. When updating the directory this method will determine if the entry already exists (same record type and guid values) and replace it or it will add a new entry if it doesnt already exist.

Parameters:
payload - A string containing the payload to store.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

toString

public final String toString()
Convert COR object to literal string value.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
A string representation of the COR, same as stored in ldap.
